name: St. Casimir

locations.description: Prince of Poland and Lithuania, patron of Poland and Lithuania

summary: Casimir was a prince of the Kingdom of Poland and Grand Duchy of Lithuania, known for his piety, chastity, and devotion to the poor. Despite being heir to the throne, he chose a life of prayer and service. He is the patron saint of Poland and Lithuania, and is invoked for chastity and youth.
